newsitem.title: USA: MVSI sets terms of proposed e-Net purchase.
newsitem.headline: MVSI sets terms of proposed e-Net purchase.

text.p: MVSI Inc said Monday it had negotiated the conditions under a term sheet for the proposed acquisition of e-Net Inc, a development-stage telecommunications company.
Under the deal, e-Net would become a wholly-owned subsidiary of MVSI, it said.
MVSI said it would exchange on a proposed tax-free basis 6.0 million of its shares and warrants for all of the 12 million shares and warrants held by e-Net's stockholders.
MVSI said it would also give at least $5.3 million to e-Net during a 24-month period ending in September 1998 in order to finance its business operations.
It said it planned to keep expanding its business and operations through the merger or acquisition of other U.S. or foreign companies.
MVSI makes vision-based robotic and sensor products and systems.
